#> [[7]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0326"
#> 
#> [[7]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[7]]$`_source`
#> [[7]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The GII product consists of a set of indices which describe the stability of the atmosphere. These indices are highly empirical in nature and might even be only relevant in certain geographic regions or under certain circumstances.\r\nLifted-Index is one of the four common instability indices included in GII.\r\nLifted-index is defined as follows\r\nLifted-Index = T(500hPa) – T(near surface, lifted to 500hPa)Where: \r\n\t- T is the air temperature at the indicated levels,\r\n        - TD the observed dew point temperature at the indicated levels"
#>

MSG - 0 degree 2021-04-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation EO:EUM:DAT:0326 https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38750 Global Instabilty Index Product Guide http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/15384 ATBD for the MSG GII/TOZ Product http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38054 MSG-3 System Commissioning Product Validation Test Report http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author The GII product consists of a set of indices which describe the stability of the atmosphere. These indices are highly empirical in nature and might even be only relevant in certain geographic regions or under certain circumstances. Lifted-Index is one of the four common instability indices included in GII. Lifted-index is defined as follows Lifted-Index = T(500hPa) – T(near surface, lifted to 500hPa)Where: - T is the air temperature at the indicated levels, - TD the observed dew point temperature at the indicated levels European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://vnavigator.eumetsat.int/preview/GII_Lift-ind.jpg Atmosphere Cloud http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - These indices are highly empirical in nature and might even be only relevant in certain geographic regions or under certain circumstances.&#xD;\nLifted-Index is one of the four common instability indices included in GII.&#xD;\nLifted-index is defined as follows&#xD;\nLifted-Index = T(500hPa) – T(near surface, lifted to 500hPa)Where: &#xD;\n\t- T is the air temperature at the indicated levels,&#xD;\n        - TD the observed dew point temperature at the indicated #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0326\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,MSG,GeoTIFF,Meteosat Second Generation (MSG),Atmosphere,Optical,Cloud,SEVIRI\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-67.5  67.5  67.5  -67.5\"}},\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://vnavigator.eumetsat.int/preview/GII_Lift-ind.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"GeoTIFF\",\"description\":\"The GII product consists of a set of indices which describe the stability of the atmosphere. #> [[8]]
#> [[8]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"

#> [1] "record"

#> [[8]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0191"

#> [[8]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[8]]$`_source`
#> [[8]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite image based upon data from solar and infrared channels from Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3). The images are a combination of two AVHRR RGB composite products: the Natural Colour (daytime product based on solar channels) and Night Microphysics (i.e. Fog) product (based upon infrared channels, tuned for night-time conditions). \nThe product displays images composed of the last six AVHRR orbits, using the Natural Colour product in the daytime part and the Fog product in the night-time part. The indicated time represents the end of the last orbit (when the satellite crosses the equator in the ascending node). \nNatural Colour RGB images are created by combining data from three solar channels: 1.6 µm channel (NIR1.61, visualized in red), 0.87 µm channel (NIR0.87, visualized in green) and 0.63 µm channel (VIS0.63, visualized in blue). Its purpose is to supply general cloud analysis, by providing information on cloud top phase and cloud optical thickness in cloudy areas, and on the green vegetation fraction ('chlorophyll content') in cloud-free areas. In most cases, water clouds can be distinguished from ice clouds. Snow-covered land is easy to distinguish from snow-free land and from water clouds and fog. The colours are (relatively) close to the natural colours of the depicted features. \nThe Night Microphysics RGB (i.e. RGB Fog) images are created by combining data from the 12.0, 10.8 and 3.74 µm channels (IR12.0, IR10.8 and IR3.74 respectively). Brightness temperature differences are displayed in red (IR12.0- IR10.8) and green (IR12.0- IR3.9), while the IR10.8 channel is shown in blue beam. Its main purpose is to distinguish fog and low clouds from cloud-free areas at night, but it contains also information on cloud top temperature, cloud optical thickness and cloud top phase, thus revealing other cloud types. Cloud-free areas contain information on low-level moisture and surface temperature. \nThe Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3) is a multipurpose imaging instrument used for global monitoring of cloud cover, sea surface temperature, ice, snow and vegetation cover characteristics. It operates at six different channels simultaneously at a spatial resolution of about 1 Km near-nadir. AVHRR has many applications in oceanography, meteorology and terrestrial sciences."

#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0191 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Atmosphere theme.par.Cloud theme.par.Land dis.View sat.Metop sat.Metop.AVHRR view.Satellite.Metop B.RGBs view.Theme.Atmospheric Composition European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode pointOfContact pointOfContact 2020-03-11 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 AVHRR RGB Natural Colour + Fog 6 orbits accumulated - Metop B 2019-11-04 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation EO:EUM:DAT:0191 https://www.eumetsat.int/media/39253 AVHRR - Factsheet http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author http://www.eumetrain.org/data/4/461/index.htm Training Module on METOP AVHRR RGB Images http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38128 AVHRR L1 Product Generation Specification http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38675 AVHRR 3 Level 1 Product Format Specification http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author This is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite image based upon data from solar and infrared channels from Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3). The images are a combination of two AVHRR RGB composite products: the Natural Colour (daytime product based on solar channels) and Night Microphysics (i.e. Fog) product (based upon infrared channels, tuned for night-time conditions). The product displays images composed of the last six AVHRR orbits, using the Natural Colour product in the daytime part and the Fog product in the night-time part. The indicated time represents the end of the last orbit (when the satellite crosses the equator in the ascending node). Natural Colour RGB images are created by combining data from three solar channels: 1.6 µm channel (NIR1.61, visualized in red), 0.87 µm channel (NIR0.87, visualized in green) and 0.63 µm channel (VIS0.63, visualized in blue). Its purpose is to supply general cloud analysis, by providing information on cloud top phase and cloud optical thickness in cloudy areas, and on the green vegetation fraction ('chlorophyll content') in cloud-free areas. In most cases, water clouds can be distinguished from ice clouds. Snow-covered land is easy to distinguish from snow-free land and from water clouds and fog. The colours are (relatively) close to the natural colours of the depicted features. The Night Microphysics RGB (i.e. RGB Fog) images are created by combining data from the 12.0, 10.8 and 3.74 µm channels (IR12.0, IR10.8 and IR3.74 respectively). Brightness temperature differences are displayed in red (IR12.0- IR10.8) and green (IR12.0- IR3.9), while the IR10.8 channel is shown in blue beam. Its main purpose is to distinguish fog and low clouds from cloud-free areas at night, but it contains also information on cloud top temperature, cloud optical thickness and cloud top phase, thus revealing other cloud types. Cloud-free areas contain information on low-level moisture and surface temperature. The Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3) is a multipurpose imaging instrument used for global monitoring of cloud cover, sea surface temperature, ice, snow and vegetation cover characteristics. It operates at six different channels simultaneously at a spatial resolution of about 1 Km near-nadir. AVHRR has many applications in oceanography, meteorology and terrestrial sciences. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Operational European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/eps-metop1_natural_fog_THUMBNAIL_small.jpg Atmosphere Cloud Land http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - http://standards.iso.org/iso/19139/resources/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_RestrictionCode otherRestrictions http://standards.iso.org/iso/19139/resources/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_RestrictionCode otherRestrictions https://www.eumetsat.int/eumetsat-data-licensing NoConditions http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_CharacterSetCode utf8 climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere x868aaa unknown unknown true -180 180 -90 90 Global - http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_CoverageContentTypeCode image AVHRR (vis,IR) European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode distributor distributor https://view.eumetsat.int/productviewer?v=eps:m01_rgb_natural_fog https View on EUMETView CI_OnLineFunctionCode order View GeoTIFF - eps_m01_rgb_natural_fog.tif MB 26 ~14 (per day) false http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Metop Metop AVHRR 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation AVHRR z270aaa z270aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Radiometer http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO"

3 Level 1 Product Format Specification</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>This is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite image based upon data from solar and infrared channels from Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3). The images are a combination of two AVHRR RGB composite products: the Natural Colour (daytime product based on solar channels) and Night Microphysics (i.e. Fog) product (based upon infrared channels, tuned for night-time conditions). \nThe product displays images composed of the last six AVHRR orbits, using the Natural Colour product in the daytime part and the Fog product in the night-time part. The indicated time represents the end of the last orbit (when the satellite crosses the equator in the ascending node). \nNatural Colour RGB images are created by combining data from three solar channels: 1.6 µm channel (NIR1.61, visualized in red), 0.87 µm channel (NIR0.87, visualized in green) and 0.63 µm channel (VIS0.63, visualized in blue). Its purpose is to supply general cloud analysis, by providing information on cloud top phase and cloud optical thickness in cloudy areas, and on the green vegetation fraction ('chlorophyll content') in cloud-free areas. In most cases, water clouds can be distinguished from ice clouds. Snow-covered land is easy to distinguish from snow-free land and from water clouds and fog. The colours are (relatively) close to the natural colours of the depicted features. \nThe Night Microphysics RGB (i.e. RGB Fog) images are created by combining data from the 12.0, 10.8 and 3.74 µm channels (IR12.0, IR10.8 and IR3.74 respectively). Brightness temperature differences are displayed in red (IR12.0- IR10.8) and green (IR12.0- IR3.9), while the IR10.8 channel is shown in blue beam. Its main purpose is to distinguish fog and low clouds from cloud-free areas at night, but it contains also information on cloud top temperature, cloud optical thickness and cloud top phase, thus revealing other cloud types. Cloud-free areas contain information on low-level moisture and surface temperature. \nThe Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3) is a multipurpose imaging instrument used for global monitoring of cloud cover, sea surface temperature, ice, snow and vegetation cover characteristics. It operates at six different channels simultaneously at a spatial resolution of about 1 Km near-nadir. AVHRR has many applications in oceanography, meteorology and terrestrial sciences.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" codeListValue=\"Operational\"/></gmd:status><gmd:pointOfContact><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:individualName><gco:CharacterString>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</gco:CharacterString></gmd:individualName><gmd:organisationName><gco:CharacterString>EUMETSAT</gco:CharacterString></gmd:organisationName><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:phone><gmd:CI_Telephone><gmd:voice><gco:CharacterString>+49(0)6151-807 #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0191\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Radiometer\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Metop,GeoTIFF,Atmosphere,LEO,Cloud,Land,Radiometer,AVHRR\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/eps-metop1_natural_fog_THUMBNAIL_small.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"GeoTIFF\",\"description\":\"This is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite image based upon data from solar and infrared channels from Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3). The images are a combination of two AVHRR RGB composite products: the Natural Colour (daytime product based on solar channels) and Night Microphysics (i.e. Fog) product (based upon infrared channels, tuned for night-time conditions). \\nThe product displays images composed of the last six AVHRR orbits, using the Natural Colour product in the daytime part and the Fog product in the night-time part. The indicated time represents the end of the last orbit (when the satellite crosses the equator in the ascending node). \\nNatural Colour RGB images are created by combining data from three solar channels: 1.6 µm channel (NIR1.61, visualized in red), 0.87 µm channel (NIR0.87, visualized in green) and 0.63 µm channel (VIS0.63, visualized in blue). Its purpose is to supply general cloud analysis, by providing information on cloud top phase and cloud optical thickness in cloudy areas, and on the green vegetation fraction ('chlorophyll content') in cloud-free areas. In most cases, water clouds can be distinguished from ice clouds. Snow-covered land is easy to distinguish from snow-free land and from water clouds and fog. The colours are (relatively) close to the natural colours of the depicted features. \\nThe Night Microphysics RGB (i.e. RGB Fog) images are created by combining data from the 12.0, 10.8 and 3.74 µm channels (IR12.0, IR10.8 and IR3.74 respectively). Brightness temperature differences are displayed in red (IR12.0- IR10.8) and green (IR12.0- IR3.9), while the IR10.8 channel is shown in blue beam. Its main purpose is to distinguish fog and low clouds from cloud-free areas at night, but it contains also information on cloud top temperature, cloud optical thickness and cloud top phase, thus revealing other cloud types. Cloud-free areas contain information on low-level moisture and surface temperature. \\nThe Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer/3 (AVHRR/3) is a multipurpose imaging instrument used for global monitoring of cloud cover, sea surface temperature, ice, snow and vegetation cover characteristics. It operates at six different channels simultaneously at a spatial resolution of about 1 Km near-nadir. AVHRR has many applications in oceanography, meteorology and terrestrial sciences.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0191\",\"name\":\"AVHRR RGB Natural Colour + Fog 6 orbits accumulated - Metop B\"}"

#> 
#> [[9]]$`_source`
#> [[9]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This product is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based upon data from S3B single swath OLCI L1 NRT products Top-Of-Atmosphere (TOA) radiometric measurements, radiometrically corrected, calibrated and spectrally characterised. The product is composed from data from a combination of the following OLCI bands: 0a02_radiance, Oa06_radiance, Oa08_radiance. The images are generated with a pixel resolution of 0.09 degrees.\n'Ocean colour' is the change in the colour of the ocean, and other water bodies such as lakes, due to the substances dissolved and particles suspended within the water. The primary objective of OLCI products is to measure the colour of the ocean and land surface and provide information on ocean and land characteristics related to this (e.g. biology). OLCI also provides information on the atmosphere and contributes to climate studies. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme."
#>

#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0182 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Atmosphere theme.par.Cloud theme.par.Land theme.par.Level_1_Data dis.View sat.Sentinel-3 view.Satellite.Sentinel 3B.RGBs view.Theme.Ocean European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode pointOfContact pointOfContact 2020-03-12 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 OLCI Level 1B RGB - Sentinel-3B S3B_OL_1_RGB 2017-05-12 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation EO:EUM:DAT:0182 https://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Satellites/CurrentSatellites/Sentinel3/OceanColourServices/index.html EUMETSAT Ocean Colour page http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/45743 Sentinel-3 OLCI Marine User Handbook http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38641 Product Data Format Specification - OLCI Level 1 & Level 2 Instrument Products http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/media/38642 Product Data Format Specification - Product Structures http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Satellites/CurrentSatellites/Sentinel3/OceanColourServices/index.html#OceanColourPNs OLCI Product Notices http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/olci-processing-baselines OLCI Processing Baselines http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Satellites/CurrentSatellites/Sentinel3/OceanColourServices/index.html#OceanColourDocs OLCI Documents (ATBD etc) http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author This product is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based upon data from S3B single swath OLCI L1 NRT products Top-Of-Atmosphere (TOA) radiometric measurements, radiometrically corrected, calibrated and spectrally characterised. The product is composed from data from a combination of the following OLCI bands: 0a02_radiance, Oa06_radiance, Oa08_radiance. The images are generated with a pixel resolution of 0.09 degrees. 'Ocean colour' is the change in the colour of the ocean, and other water bodies such as lakes, due to the substances dissolved and particles suspended within the water. The primary objective of OLCI products is to measure the colour of the ocean and land surface and provide information on ocean and land characteristics related to this (e.g. biology). OLCI also provides information on the atmosphere and contributes to climate studies. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Operational European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/IMG_OLCI_EUMETVIEW_400px.jpg Atmosphere Cloud Land Level 1 Data Ocean http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - Documents (ATBD etc)</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>This product is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based upon data from S3B single swath OLCI L1 NRT products Top-Of-Atmosphere (TOA) radiometric measurements, radiometrically corrected, calibrated and spectrally characterised. The product is composed from data from a combination of the following OLCI bands: 0a02_radiance, Oa06_radiance, Oa08_radiance. The images are generated with a pixel resolution of 0.09 degrees.\n'Ocean colour' is the change in the colour of the ocean, and other water bodies such as lakes, due to the substances dissolved and particles suspended within the water. The primary objective of OLCI products is to measure the colour of the ocean and land surface and provide information on ocean and land characteristics related to this (e.g. biology). OLCI also provides information on the atmosphere and contributes to climate studies. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0182\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GeoTIFF,Sentinel-3,Atmosphere,Optical,OLCI,LEO,Cloud,Ocean,Level 1 Data,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/IMG_OLCI_EUMETVIEW_400px.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"GeoTIFF\",\"description\":\"This product is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based upon data from S3B single swath OLCI L1 NRT products Top-Of-Atmosphere (TOA) radiometric measurements, radiometrically corrected, calibrated and spectrally characterised. The product is composed from data from a combination of the following OLCI bands: 0a02_radiance, Oa06_radiance, Oa08_radiance. The images are generated with a pixel resolution of 0.09 degrees.\\n'Ocean colour' is the change in the colour of the ocean, and other water bodies such as lakes, due to the substances dissolved and particles suspended within the water. The primary objective of OLCI products is to measure the colour of the ocean and land surface and provide information on ocean and land characteristics related to this (e.g. biology). OLCI also provides information on the atmosphere and contributes to climate studies. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0182\",\"name\":\"OLCI Level 1B RGB - Sentinel-3B\"}"

#> [[10]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0621"
#> 
#> [[10]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[10]]$`_source`
#> [[10]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Instantaneous precipitation maps over IODC area generated combining geostationary (GEO) IR images from operational geostationary satellites 'calibrated' by precipitation measurements from MW images on Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites, processed soon after each acquisition of a new image from GEO. The blending algorithm ('Rapid Update’) generates precipitation estimates combining the equivalent blackbody temperatures (TBB) at 10.8 μm with rain rates from all available Passive MW measurements. A separate treatment is performed for convective precipitation: the morphologic information and the enhancement of precipitation estimate is done by the use of NEFODINA software."
#>

#> [[10]]$`_source`$fulltext
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0621 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Precipitation theme.par.Weather view.Theme.Weather dis.View sat.MSG view.Satellite.MSG IODC.Products EUMETSAT SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management H SAF Via Pratica di Mare, 45 c/o Aeroporto M. De Bernardi Pomezia ROMA Italian Air Force Meteorological Service - Operative Centre for Meteorology (COMet) 00071 Italy us_hsaf@meteoam.it http://h-saf.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator 2023-01-30 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 Precipitation rate at ground by GEO/IR supported by LEO/MW - MSG - Indian Ocean P-IN-SEVIRI_E H63 2022-06-09 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation EO:EUM:DAT:0621 Instantaneous precipitation maps over IODC area generated combining geostationary (GEO) IR images from operational geostationary satellites 'calibrated' by precipitation measurements from MW images on Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites, processed soon after each acquisition of a new image from GEO. The blending algorithm ('Rapid Update’) generates precipitation estimates combining the equivalent blackbody temperatures (TBB) at 10.8 μm with rain rates from all available Passive MW measurements. A separate treatment is performed for convective precipitation: the morphologic information and the enhancement of precipitation estimate is done by the use of NEFODINA software. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Operational EUMETSAT SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management H SAF Via Pratica di Mare, 45 c/o Aeroporto M. De Bernardi Pomezia ROMA Italian Air Force Meteorological Service - Operative Centre for Meteorology (COMet) 00071 Italy us_hsaf@meteoam.it http://h-saf.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/h63_20220701_1115_fdk.png Precipitation Weather http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_RestrictionCode copyright http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_RestrictionCode copyright https://www.eumetsat.int/eumetsat-data-licensing NoConditions http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_CharacterSetCode utf8 climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere x1351aaa 2022-06-09 unknown true -34.5 125.5 -60 67.5 Regional - http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_CoverageContentTypeCode image Visualisation EUMETSAT SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management H SAF Via Pratica di Mare, 45 c/o Aeroporto M. De Bernardi Pomezia ROMA Italian Air Force Meteorological Service - Operative Centre for Meteorology (COMet) 00071 Italy us_hsaf@meteoam.it http://h-saf.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode distributor distributor https://view.eumetsat.int/productviewer?v=msg_iodc:h63 https View on EUMETView CI_OnLineFunctionCode information https://view.eumetsat.int/geoserver/ows?service=WMS&request=GetMap&version=1.3.0&layers=msg_iodc:h63&styles=&format=image/geotiff&crs=EPSG:4326&bbox=-77,-35,77,125&width=800&height=800 https Latest image CI_OnLineFunctionCode download View GeoTIFF - msg_iodc-h63.tif MB 2 96 (per day) false European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode distributor distributor http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema#ShownAsEUMETSATData MSG Meteosat Second Generation (MSG) SEVIRI 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation SEVIRI z641aaa z641aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Optical http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode GEO degree 45.5"

MSG - Indian Ocean</gco:CharacterString></gmd:title><gmd:alternateTitle><gco:CharacterString>P-IN-SEVIRI_E</gco:CharacterString></gmd:alternateTitle><gmd:alternateTitle><gco:CharacterString>H63</gco:CharacterString></gmd:alternateTitle><gmd:date><gmd:CI_Date><gmd:date><gco:Date>2022-06-09</gco:Date></gmd:date><gmd:dateType><gmd:CI_DateTypeCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode\" codeListValue=\"creation\"/></gmd:dateType></gmd:CI_Date></gmd:date><gmd:identifier><gmd:MD_Identifier><gmd:code><gco:CharacterString>EO:EUM:DAT:0621</gco:CharacterString></gmd:code></gmd:MD_Identifier></gmd:identifier></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Instantaneous precipitation maps over IODC area generated combining geostationary (GEO) IR images from operational geostationary satellites 'calibrated' by precipitation measurements from MW images on Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites, processed soon after each acquisition of a new image from GEO. The blending algorithm ('Rapid Update’) generates precipitation estimates combining the equivalent blackbody temperatures (TBB) at 10.8 μm with rain rates from all available Passive MW measurements. A separate treatment is performed for convective precipitation: the morphologic information and the enhancement of precipitation estimate is done by the use of NEFODINA software.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" codeListValue=\"Operational\"/></gmd:status><gmd:pointOfContact><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:individualName><gco:CharacterString>EUMETSAT SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management</gco:CharacterString></gmd:individualName><gmd:organisationName><gco:CharacterString>H SAF</gco:CharacterString></gmd:organisationName><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:phone><gmd:CI_Telephone><gmd:voice><gco:CharacterString/></gmd:voice><gmd:facsimile><gco:CharacterString/></gmd:facsimile></gmd:CI_Telephone></gmd:phone><gmd:address><gmd:CI_Address><gmd:deliveryPoint><gco:CharacterString>Via Pratica di Mare, 45  c/o Aeroporto M. De Bernardi</gco:CharacterString></gmd:deliveryPoint><gmd:city><gco:CharacterString>Pomezia  ROMA</gco:CharacterString></gmd:city><gmd:administrativeArea><gco:CharacterString>Italian Air Force (COMet)</gco:CharacterString></gmd:administrativeArea><gmd:postalCode><gco:CharacterString>00071</gco:CharacterString></gmd:postalCode><gmd:country><gco:CharacterString>Italy</gco:CharacterString></gmd:country><gmd:electronicMailAddress><gco:CharacterString>us_hsaf@meteoam.it</gco:CharacterString></gmd:electronicMailAddress></gmd:CI_Address></gmd:address><gmd:onlineResource><gmd:CI_OnlineResource><gmd:linkage><gmd:URL>http://h-saf.eumetsat.int</gmd:URL></gmd:linkage></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0621\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"H SAF\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"email\":\"us_hsaf@meteoam.it\",\"url\":\"http://h-saf.eumetsat.int\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2022\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"H SAF\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"email\":\"us_hsaf@meteoam.it\",\"url\":\"http://h-saf.eumetsat.int\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Sun Jan 09 00:06:00 GMT 2022\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,MSG,Weather,GeoTIFF,Precipitation,Meteosat Second Generation (MSG),Optical,SEVIRI\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"H SAF\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"email\":\"us_hsaf@meteoam.it\",\"url\":\"http://h-saf.eumetsat.int\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-34.5  67.5  125.5  -60.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Sun Jan 09 00:06:00 GMT 2022 / Mon Jan 30 17:24:30 GMT 2023\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/h63_20220701_1115_fdk.png\",\"encodingFormat\":\"GeoTIFF\",\"description\":\"Instantaneous precipitation maps over IODC area generated combining geostationary (GEO) IR images from operational geostationary satellites 'calibrated' by precipitation measurements from MW images on Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellites, processed soon after each acquisition of a new image from GEO. The blending algorithm ('Rapid Update’) generates precipitation estimates combining the equivalent blackbody temperatures (TBB) at 10.8 μm with rain rates from all available Passive MW measurements. A separate treatment is performed for convective precipitation: the morphologic information and the enhancement of precipitation estimate is done by the use of NEFODINA software.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0621\",\"name\":\"Precipitation rate at ground by GEO/IR supported by LEO/MW - MSG - Indian Ocean\"}"
